result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony David Amsden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

With Huber and Good Time Credit
Concurrent with: 14CF46

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony David Amsden

records.addlTxt: RN/SDC Letter ret undeliverable-unable to forward
from Defendant to Court, Dated 2/13/2015 Re: Request for Furlough

14CF28 & 14CF46, cases called at 10:59 am . Defendant Anthony David Amsden in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement has been reached and read into the record by ADA Anderson. State moves to amend Count 1 to Misd. Possession of THC in 14CF28, amend Count 1 in 14CF46 to Misd. Battery and amend Count 3 to Misd. Bail Jumping in 14CF46.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts amendments as requested by the State. Plea: No Contest to Count 1 of 14CF28 & No Contest to Count 1 & Count 3 of 14CF46. No Statement by defendant.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2 in 14CF46. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Szilagyi. No statement by defendant.  Court sentences the defendant to: EACH COUNT-6 months WCJ, concurrent to each other, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Sentence to begin no later than January 5, 2015.  Credit for 11 days served. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan, Court orders bond on file to be applied. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 9, 2014 at 11:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Anthony David Amsden in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 11:00 am.
AMENDED
